headline: Apollo Global Management (APO): Analyzing Valuation as Analyst Optimism and New Leadership Drive Investor Interest
summary: Recent commentary from Goldman Sachs has cast Apollo Global Management (APO) in a positive light, citing its advantageous position as an alternative asset manager while credit markets remain turbulent. Investors are watching closely ahead of the upcoming third-quarter earnings release, which is driving renewed interest in the stock. See our latest analysis for Apollo Global Management. It has been an eventful stretch for Apollo, including a leadership shakeup in its real estate and Asia...

headline: WestCX Elevates Pharmacy Operations with New Agentic AI Solution
summary: Strategic AI for Enhanced Adherence, Efficiency, and Revenue GrowthOMAHA, Neb., Oct. 21, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- WestCX, part of the West Technology Group, today announced the launch of its agentic AI solution engineered to optimize pharmacy-patient interactions. headline: Apollo Names Bert Crouch Head of Real Estate Equity
summary: NEW YORK, Oct. 21, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Apollo (NYSE: APO) today announced that Bert Crouch has been named Partner and Head of Real Estate Equity at Apollo. Crouch will lead Apollo’s real estate equity business, encompassing Bridge Investment Group (“Bridge”), the real estate equity platform company acquired earlier this year, as well as the firm’s existing strategies. headline: Will Eiji Ueda’s Appointment as Asia Pacific Head Change Apollo Global Management's (APO) Narrative?
summary: Apollo Global Management recently announced that Eiji Ueda, former Chief Investment Officer at Japan’s Government Pension Investment Fund, will take over as Partner and Head of Asia Pacific, succeeding Matt Michelini, who will shift to wider leadership responsibilities after overseeing the transition. This leadership change brings extensive experience in Asian markets to Apollo’s regional operations, reflecting the firm’s ambition to further expand its presence and investment expertise in...

headline: Thames Water defers decision on fight for higher bills
summary: Thames Water has deferred its planned challenge to the industry regulator's curbs on customer bill increases, amid continuing efforts to secure a potential buyer for the cash-strapped business.  Britain's biggest supplier had already put aside its fight for higher bills but had faced a deadline of Wednesday to make a final decision.  Thames (TWUL) is currently focused on a private sector solution to its financial crisis that would see a group of its biggest creditors take control of the company - averting the prospect of a Special Administration Regime.

headline: Las Vegas Strip resort venue files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
summary: Bankruptcy filings are not a common occurrence among Las Vegas Strip casinos and businesses. The last significant bankruptcy on the Strip was over 10 years ago in January 2015 when Caesars Entertainment, then-owned by Apollo Global Management and TPG Capital, filed for Chapter 11 to eliminate about ...
